name: hegemonic
content:

strong and powerful and therefore able to control others, or relating to the idea that a country is like this: Now a different hegemonic power sought to force its will on the rest of the world. Some saw the Euro as a means to challenge the Dollar as the world's hegemonic currency. See
hegemony
More examplesFewer examplesThe United States is viewed as having a global hegemonic role in the world.This hegemonic view pays too much attention to military might.The EU was founded on a rejection of the hegemonic power politics that had plagued the continent for much of the previous four centuries.
